name: Guidance Aviation
baseAirport: PRC -Prescott Regional - Ernest A Love Field
about: Guidance Aviation is an FAA-approved helicopter pilot training institution, founded in 1998 by John Stonecipher. Starting with one helicopter and a single instructor, the school has grown into a leading collegiate helicopter flight training academy with a fleet of 26 aircraft and over 100 employees. Guidance Aviation is recognized for producing pilots who set the standard in professionalism and safety. The school's training program is streamlined and structured, utilizing benchmarks and simulation technology to maximize efficiency and reduce flight costs. With a graduate placement rate above 90%, Guidance Aviation is committed to excellence in flight training and community involvement. The school's approach combines the academic structure of a university education with academy-style training, ensuring students achieve certification in a clear and effective 24-month program. Guidance Aviation strives to go above and beyond in flight training, job performance, and community service.
